body.name: Acne Cleanser, Gentle Clearing Face Wash, Benzoyl Peroxide Treatment for Acne Prone Skin, Milky Gel Texture, Fragrance Free, 5.07 fl oz (Pack of 1)
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 21 hrs 2 mins
features: HELPS TREAT & PREVENT ACNE – Formulated with 2.5% benzoyl peroxide to gently help treat and prevent breakouts without stripping the skin
LUXURIOUS FEEL – Daily acne face wash with a luxurious milky gel texture, made with hydrating glycerin and allantoin to help soothe and support a healthy skin barrier

FOR OILY & ACNE PRONE SKIN – Designed for those with combination, oily or blemish prone skin to use morning and night. Perfect for men, women, teens, or anyone looking to complement their existing routine
CLEAN & EFFECTIVE FORMULA – Dermatologist-designed, fragrance-free, sulfate-free and paraben-free, 100% vegan, cruelty-free skincare, Leaping Bunny Certified
CUROLOGY – Dermatologist founded, developed, and tested

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It works as promised and it's gentle on my skin. I can actually use it every day because I like the smell/texture and it doesn't dehydrate my skin.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Cleanses without drying out
reviews.reviewText: Works well without drying out the skin. This is a high quality cleanser from a very reputable brand. It does not irritate my skin but leaves it feeling fresh and clean. Would recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gentle but strong
reviews.reviewText: I love Curology products, but this was my first time experimenting with this specific cleanser. I really like it and have incorporated it into my nighttime skincare routine. It gets my makeup off easily, even stubborn mascara, and gives all the benefits of benzoyl peroxide. If your skin isn't used to this ingredient, it's important that you take it easy. I recommend using it once every few days to see how your skin responds - don't jump right in to using it daily. It can dry your skin out horribly or make it very sensitive if you do too much too soon. If you have any issues I also recommend mixing it with another face wash to dilute it a bit, at least while your skin adjusts.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I use this once every three or four days and combine it into my weekly rotation of different cleansers. This cleanser is gentle yet gets my oily combination skin clean without any side effects.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Cleans well but started having skin irritation
reviews.reviewText: My wife and I both tried this cleanser and had different reactions to it. I immediately noticed the scent which was like a medicated type of scent and wasn't enjoyable to me and it turned me off to continuing it, so my wife gave it a try. We both agree that it leaves your face feeling clean, but after about 3 days of her using it, she began having an itchy sensation all over her face with some dry patches in addition to the skin on her face having a mild rough texture to it rather than feeling smooth as before so she stopped using it because the itching was unbearable and even using moisturizer wasn't helping. Neither of us have used products with benzoyl peroxide in years since our acne isn't very severe, but since we've begun experiencing bouts of minor acne, we decided to give this a try since it's said to have a gentle formula, but unfortunately my senses and her skin didn't agree with it. I read that benzoyl peroxide can takes weeks to be effective, and that there are stages your skin goes through where it can be worse before it is better so this product may still be a good gentle option for some if you can bare to get passed those stages without severe skin irritation. We've had success with their Gentle Cleanser so Curology is still a good brand in our book. It all comes down to how your skin responds which of course varies.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works Well for Me
reviews.reviewText: I've use Curology products before and been happy so I was excited to try this one as well. I have difficult skin and this one works very well for me! It helps keep my blemishes down without drying my skin out too much which is a problem with other cleansers for me. I am happy with this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars removing make up well
reviews.reviewText: i'm not great about removing makeup and just rely on my acne cleanser to do it for me, and it's great for that. no issues with additional breakouts, and it's enough for me to want to order another tube and keep up with it. it's soft on my skin and don't make me feel dried out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It helped to shrink My Pores
reviews.reviewText: What I like about this Acne Cleanser: They list the expiration date at the tip of the container. It doesn’t clog my pores. Therefore, it helps with my clogged pores around my nose, making them less noticeable. It’s for all skin types normal, dry or oily. It’s a silky smooth cleanser and you will not need a lot to cleanse your face. They list all the ingredients. It was developed by dermatologist which are skin care experts. You get to nice size bottles. It contains 2.5% of benzyl peroxide so it’s less irritating for the skin.What I disliked about this Acne cleanser: Nothing
